importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the most recent update on the ongoing conflict in Gaza, highlighting the continuation of violence and violations of the ceasefire despite international efforts to enforce peace.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period since the ceasefire began shows the sustained escalation of hostilities, with Israel reportedly killing 97 Palestinians, indicating a significant breach of the truce agreement.

keyTakeAways: Israel has been accused of breaching the ceasefire agreement in Gaza, with the Gaza Government Media Office reporting 80 violations, including 21 on Sunday.
The UN relief coordinator conducted an inspection of the devastated areas in Gaza City, underscoring the humanitarian crisis caused by the ongoing violence.
The article highlights a serious breakdown in the ceasefire, with multiple violations reported, raising global concerns about the sustainability of peace efforts in the region.

namedEntities.name: Israel
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation-state and military actor involved in the conflict in Gaza
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Israel is central to the article as the entity accused of violating the ceasefire agreement, resulting in the killing of 97 Palestinians since the ceasefire began.

namedEntities.name: Gaza
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A region in Palestine, currently under blockade and conflict
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Gaza region is the site of the violence and the ceasefire violations reported, making it a key location for understanding the humanitarian and political context.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Government Media Office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A governmental body responsible for official reporting from Gaza
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Gaza Government Media Office is cited as the source of the claim that Israel has breached the ceasefire 80 times, lending credibility to the reported violations.

namedEntities.name: United Nations (UN) relief coordinator
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An official representing the UN in humanitarian affairs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The UN relief coordinator's inspection of Gaza City highlights the international community's response to the crisis and the severe humanitarian damage caused.

namedEntities.name: Faisal Ali
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A journalist or reporter contributing to the article
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Faisal Ali is one of the authors of the article, contributing to the reporting and dissemination of information about the conflict in Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Usaid Siddiqui
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A journalist or reporter contributing to the article
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Usaid Siddiqui is the co-author of the article, sharing responsibility in reporting on the conflict and its developments.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Since the start of a ceasefire, Israel has been accused of breaching the agreement 80 times, including 21 violations on Sunday, with the Gaza Government Media Office reporting 97 Palestinian deaths. The UN relief coordinator has inspected the devastated areas of Gaza City, signaling the severity of the humanitarian crisis. This reflects a persistent failure of the ceasefire, raising global concerns about the stability and safety of the region, and the urgent need for international intervention and accountability.
title: Israel kills 97 Palestinians in Gaza since start of ceasefire
